visualization_prompt: Generate a combination line/spline chart showing monthly trends of business metrics using time-series analysis with synthetic financial data
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series variables spanning 15 monthly observations from January 2023 to March 2024. Both series demonstrate synthetic generation with domain-appropriate ranges: sales units (μ=175, σ=35) showing 11.8% quarterly growth, and satisfaction scores (μ=4.8, σ=0.4) maintaining positive correlation (r=0.72). Data incorporates trend components with residual noise (±8% variation) to simulate real-world patterns. The dual-axis line/spline combination maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while maintaining perceptual discriminability through both color (ΔE > 15) and mark type (linear vs curved). Spline interpolation emphasizes the continuous nature of satisfaction metrics, while angular line segments convey discrete sales counts. Temporal spacing follows Cairo's proportional perception principles with equal-month intervals, and value ranges maintain Weber-Fechner compliance through proportional axis scaling.
